poem:
### The National Disgrace

Their cries echo
through hospital walls,
silenced by bureaucracy,
as black mothers enter
a sterile world of scrutiny.
Figures on paper,
hearts on the line, 
lost in the arithmetic
of indifference, 
held under a gaze
that equates life
with color, 
seeing not the soul
but a statistic, 
a chapter in an ongoing dirge.
